During the passage of Hurricane Matthew over Saint Lucia, several factors contributed to the severity of the impact, although no casualties were reported in Saint Lucia itself. The storm also caused significant infrastructure issues, such as blocked roads in Castries, Gros-Islet, Dennery, and Soufriere, which were being cleared by the Ministry of Infrastructure [1]. Additionally, power outages affected hotels and other facilities, although efforts were underway to restore electricity [1][2].

The storm's impact was exacerbated by the physical damage to infrastructure, such as the collapse of a wall near the old Sunset Motors building in Marisule, Gros-Islet, and land slippage in Etangs/Soufriere, which damaged an elderly man's home [1]. The combination of these factors, including the disruption of essential services and infrastructure, contributed to the overall severity of the storm's impact on the island, although, fortunately, no casualties were reported in Saint Lucia [3][1].
